accussed_details.name: Faramoz Khan
allegation: Misconduct in obtaining legal practice license

complaint_summary: Afreen Khan filed a complaint against Faramoz Khan alleging misconduct and fraud in obtaining a legal practice license before completing his LL.B degree.
investigation_summary: The Disciplinary Committee issued a pre-admission notice to the Respondent on 24.07.2010. Written replies and objections were submitted by the Respondent on 08.01.2011, which were examined and found unconvincing. Statements from both parties were recorded, and evidence confirmed fraudulent conduct.
judgment_summary: The Tribunal found that Faramoz Khan obtained his legal practice license fraudulently before completing his LL.B degree. His licenses for subordinate courts and the Peshawar High Court were canceled. No fine was imposed due to his financial condition.
punishment: Cancellation of licenses to practice law in subordinate courts and Peshawar High Court.
Decision_or_verdict: Licenses canceled due to fraudulent conduct.
legal_arguments: Section 41 of the Legal Practitioners and Bar Council Act, 1973
Reliance on precedent: 1996 MLD 513 (Bar Council Tribunal NWFP)
statutes: Legal Practitioners and Bar Council Act, 1973

witness_statement.Afreen Khan: Alleged that the Respondent obtained his legal practice license fraudulently before completing his LL.B degree.
witness_statement.Faramoz Khan: Admitted obtaining the license before completing his LL.B degree but defended his actions based on provisional certificates.

key_issues: Fraudulent acquisition of legal practice license
Misconduct under Section 41 of the Legal Practitioners and Bar Council Act, 1973

legal_terms.Provisional Certificate: A temporary certification issued before final qualification is completed.

words_and_phrases.Misconduct: Improper or unethical behavior by a professional.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around fraudulent acquisition of legal practice licenses by Faramoz Khan before completing his LL.B degree. The Tribunal canceled his licenses for subordinate courts and Peshawar High Court under Section 41 of the Legal Practitioners and Bar Council Act, 1973, citing misconduct and fraud.
